content.question:
An urgent message for Aeneas

‘Heu fuge, nate dea, teque his’ ait‘eripeeripio, -ere: snatch, take away, rescue flammis.

Hostis habet muros; ruit alto a culmineculmen, culminis, n: peak, summit Troia.

Sat= Satis, n.: enough, a sufficient amount patriae Priamoque datum:= datum est si PergamaPergama, -orum, n. pl: the towers of Troy dextra

defendi possent, etiam hac defensa fuissent.’

Aeneid 2.289-292

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.

frqParts.text:
An urgent message for Aeneas

‘Heu fuge, nate dea, teque his’ ait‘eripeeripio, -ere: snatch, take away, rescue flammis.

Hostis habet muros; ruit alto a culmineculmen, culminis, n: peak, summit Troia.

Sat= Satis, n.: enough, a sufficient amount patriae Priamoque datum:= datum est si PergamaPergama, -orum, n. pl: the towers of Troy dextra

defendi possent, etiam hac defensa fuissent.’

Aeneid 2.289-292

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.
